intro: Alsine mucronata subsp. conferta, commonly known as the clustered alsike, is a low-growing annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features prostrate or ascending stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, sandy or loamy soils. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides, meadows, and waste areas.
